item.title: The Civilisation of Sarvara
item.description: Overview Sarvara was a Morellic city and Bronze-Age civilisation located on the river Sarav, after which it was named, in the Sarvaran River Basin.

item.title: The Morellic Culture
item.description: Overview The Morellic culture is a culture of minikin, with its homeland in the steppes of southern Tseireph. Groups The groups that form a part of the Morellic culture include:

item.title: The Tribe of Diira
item.description: Overview The Diira were a late neolithic tribe of semi-nomadic minikin native to the mediterranean regions of southern Tseireph in the 2nd realm, belonging to the Nethic culture.

item.title: The Tribe of Mora
item.description: Overview The Mora were a late neolithic tribe of pastoralist-nomadic minikin native to the steppes of Tseireph in the 2nd realm, belonging to the Morellic culture.

item.title: title
item.description: Overview Aqhor was a Morell0- Nethic city state and Bronze-age nation located at the delta of the river Sarav. The language of Aqhor was Aqhoran, a Southern Morellic language with prevalent Nethic substrate influence.
